meanings.definition: A person who believes in or supports democracy.
meanings.sent1: The young student was proud to be a democrat and always voted in school elections.
meanings.sent2: In a democracy, every citizen has the right to be a democrat and have their voice heard.
meanings.sent3: The little girl declared herself a democrat of the playground, always making sure everyone had a turn on the swings.
meanings.sent4: The seeds of democracy were planted by each individual acting as a democrat, nurturing the growth of freedom.
meanings.sent5: Being a democrat means standing up for what is right, even when it is not easy.

meanings.definition: A member or supporter of the Democratic Party in the United States.
meanings.sent1: The politician proudly declared himself a democrat and campaigned for the Democratic Party.
meanings.sent2: As a democrat, she believed in the values of the Democratic Party and worked to promote them.
meanings.sent3: The cat insisted on being a democrat, always choosing the blue bowl over the red one.
meanings.sent4: In the political arena, each democrat plays a crucial role in shaping the future of the country.
meanings.sent5: The democrat's passion for social justice fueled their dedication to the Democratic Party.
